solarSystem.name: Sun
solarSystem.description: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System and the primary source of energy for life on Earth.

solarSystem.name: Mercury
solarSystem.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun.

solarSystem.name: Venus
solarSystem.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and is similar in size and structure to Earth.

solarSystem.name: Earth
solarSystem.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life.

solarSystem.name: Mars
solarSystem.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and is often referred to as the 'Red Planet'.

solarSystem.name: Jupiter
solarSystem.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in the Solar System and has a massive system of moons.

solarSystem.name: Saturn
solarSystem.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun, known for its prominent ring system.

solarSystem.name: Uranus
solarSystem.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and has a unique sideways rotation.

solarSystem.name: Neptune
solarSystem.description: Neptune is the eighth planet from the Sun and is known for its deep blue color.
